metadata.feature_description: Analytics for wiki content including page edits, contributors, and content growth

steps.action: Navigate to PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics panel opens with module tabs
steps.actual: Community Analytics panel opened showing tabs for Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki

steps.action: Click on Wiki tab to view wiki-specific analytics
steps.expected: Wiki analytics dashboard displays with wiki-specific metrics
steps.actual: Wiki analytics section displayed with Community Health metrics, Engagement charts, Creates & Views, Trending Tags, and Popular Content sections

steps.action: Observe the Community Health section for wiki article metrics
steps.expected: Metrics related to article activity are displayed
steps.actual: Community Health section shows: 'Articles older than 24 hours with no Views' (0%), 'Articles older than 12 hours with Views but no Interaction' (0%), 'Articles older than 24 hours deleted' (0%)

steps.action: Verify Engagement section displays activity tracking
steps.actual: Engagement section shows chart with daily activity (MON-SUN) and metrics: Engagement 0%, Interacted 0, Formed Relationship 0, Shared 0

steps.action: View Engagement section for contributor activity metrics
steps.actual: Engagement section displays Interacted (0), Formed Relationship (0), Shared (0) metrics with visual chart showing activity over time

steps.action: Locate and verify Popular Content section in Wiki analytics
steps.expected: Popular Content section is present and displays popular wiki pages or indicates no data
steps.actual: Popular Content section is present and displays 'No popular content available in selected period' - feature is functional but no wiki content exists in the test environment

steps.action: Compare Wiki metrics with other module metrics to verify wiki-specific terminology
steps.expected: Wiki uses 'Articles' terminology instead of 'Questions', 'Topics', or 'Blogs'
steps.actual: Wiki Community Health section uses wiki-specific terminology: 'Articles older than 24 hours with no Views', 'Articles older than 12 hours with Views but no Interaction', 'Articles older than 24 hours deleted' - distinct from other modules which use Questions, Topics, Blogs, Events, or Ideas

steps.action: Verify Creates & Views section displays content growth metrics
steps.expected: Creates and Views metrics are displayed with charts
steps.actual: Creates & Views section shows CREATES (0) and VIEWS (0) with visual chart displaying trends over time

steps.action: Click on date range selector to change time period
steps.expected: Date range dropdown appears with options
steps.actual: Date range dropdown appeared with options: Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom

steps.expected: Date range changes to one month period and charts update
steps.actual: Date range changed from '2 Feb 2026 - 8 Feb 2026' (week) to '9 Jan 2026 - 8 Feb 2026' (month), charts updated to show full month with dates JAN 9 through FEB 8

steps.expected: Comparative Term can be changed between 1 year and 1 month
steps.actual: Comparative Term dropdown opened showing options '1 y' (1 year) and '1 m' (1 month), successfully changed from 1m to 1y

steps.action: Click Export button in Wiki analytics section
steps.expected: Wiki analytics data exports to file
steps.actual: Export button clicked successfully, file 'Wiki.xlsx' downloaded to browser

observations: All wiki data shows 0 values because no wiki content exists in the test environment during the selected time periods
Trending Tags section displays 'No trending tags available in selected period' - feature is present but no tag data exists
Popular Content section displays 'No popular content available in selected period' - feature is present but no content data exists

The Wiki module shares the same dashboard layout and functionality as other Community Analytics modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas) but uses wiki-specific terminology ('Articles' instead of module-specific terms)
Export functionality generates an Excel file (Wiki.xlsx) containing the analytics data
